title: The Week of Walter Mitchell: Counselor of Justice
summary: Walter Mitchell, a 48-year-old with a passion for advising, discovers his unique ability to bring peace and resolve conflicts supernaturally over a transformative week.
summaryGerman: Walter Mitchell, 48 Jahre alt mit einer Leidenschaft für Beratung, entdeckt seine einzigartige Fähigkeit, übernatürlich Frieden zu stiften und Konflikte zu lösen, während einer transformativen Woche.
summaryDutch: Walter Mitchell, 48 jaar oud en gepassioneerd door adviseren, ontdekt zijn unieke vermogen om vrede te brengen en conflicten bovennatuurlijk op te lossen gedurende een transformatieve week.
summaryFrench: Walter Mitchell, âgé de 48 ans et passionné par le conseil, découvre sa capacité unique à apporter la paix et à résoudre les conflits surnaturellement au cours d'une semaine transformative.

story.text: Walter Mitchell starts his week feeling peaceful when he inadvertently calms a heated argument at the local coffee shop with just a few wise words.
Motivated by yesterday's event, Walter intervenes in a community dispute over park land use, and his suggestions are met with unanimous approval.
Walter feels eerie, realizing his actions might have more than just persuasive powers; animals and nature seemed calmer when he passed the park today.
Walter assists a local school by conducting a workshop on conflict resolution, where his methods prove oddly effective, puzzling the teachers.
His reputation growing, media arrive to see the 'Peacemaker' in action. Under the gaze of cameras, Walter diplomatically mends a long-standing feud between rival neighborhood groups.
Reflecting on his week, Walter spends a quiet day at home, pondering the full effects of his newfound abilities and their implications.
Walter decides to dedicate his life to conflict resolution, declaring his intention to train others in his methods, ensuring that his abilities to promote peace continue to flourish.

ending: With great power comes great responsibility, and Walter Mitchell was ready to embrace both.
moral: The power to change the world often lies in the strength of one's words and the resolve to use them wisely.
